biography

astronautical engineer

turned

web developer

I’m a graduate of the University of Southern California with a BS in Astronautical Engineering who loves coding and wanted a career with more learning opportunities than the space industry could offer.

Since delving into web development in early 2015, I’ve completed Udacity’s Front End Web Development online nanodegree and started at the Turing School for Software & Design. I'm scheduled to complete their Full Stack Web Development program focusing on Ruby on Rails and JavaScript by June 2016.

I currently live in Denver, CO.

  • Ruby
  • JavaScript
  • HTML5
  • CSS3
  • Adobe Illustrator

Udacity Project 1: Portfolio Site

This project was an introduction to HTML and CSS, including using Bootstrap as responsive framework. It features a key logo I designed using Adobe Illustrator and some of my paintings.

View Project Github Repo

Udacity Project 2: jQuery Resume

This project was an introduction to using jQuery to dynamically populate the DOM. Udacity provided the main code for the Google Maps feature and some initial helper code for adding jQuery elements. I added unique styles and layout using CSS3 and HTML5.

View Project Github Repo

Udacity Project 3: Arcade Game

This project uses HTML5 Canvas and JavaScript to create an arcade game based on the classic Frogger. Udacity provided the art assets and the game engine. I coded the players, enemies, and other entities in JavaScript's object-oriented psuedo-classical style and added the unique objectie to get specific objects to target spaces.

View Project Github Repo

Udacity Project 4: Web Optimization

This project was provided by Udacity with specific performance-related bugs that needed to be fixed. The main page needed to achieve a score of at least 90 for both mobile and desktop on Google's PageSpeed Insights. Additionally, on the Cam's Pizzeria page, the goal was to optimize the critcal rendering path to make the main page render as quickly as possible when scrolling. I modified the JavaScript and used Grunt to create a workflow to inline the CSS, minify the files, optimize the images, and measure the performance.

View Project Github Repo

Udacity Project 5: Brewery Map

This project was created entirely from scratch using KnockoutJS's Model-View-Controller architecture to dynamically display, search, and filter breweries I have been to in Denver, CO. It utilizes the Google Maps API & Yelp API to mark brewery locations and get Yelp ratings. Additionally, it uses jQuery's AJAX requests to retrieve the ratings from Yelp asynchonously.

View Project Github Repo

Udacity Project 6: Test Driven Development Feedreader

This project uses the test suite Jasmine to test the basic functionality of a feedreader app provided by Udacity. I wrote seven tests for the app including tests for the RSS feeds, the menu, initial entries, and new feed selections.

View Project Github Repo

Personal Project: Online Responsive Resume

This project is a spin on Udacity Project 2, but uses HTML and CSS for each section instead of jQuery. I wanted a way to showcase my bold style and to have an online version of my paper resume.

View Project Github Repo
